Articles.Content: When I look at map view, I can't see the flags I have planted. When I try to pull down the little bar at the top of the screen, I can't click anything there. Any ideas?

Go to the Tracking Station and activate the Flags button there; anything you want to see in the map screen MUST be activated in the Tracking Station, otherwise you're out of luck.

Don't know if that's an intended feature or a bug; it's annoying either way.

You can change thee the object types displayed directly in map view as well.

Make sure the navball is visible (click on the little arrow at the bottom, or press the num pad '.' key) and then move the mouse to the top-center of the screen.

The same icons as in the tracking center will pop down, and you can select which to show.

The only time I've been unable to change the displayed objects in map view or the tracking centre was when KSP was starting to get low on memory, then almost nothing works. Close and restart the programme then try again.

**Make sure the navball is visible**

It's a known bug that you can't change any of the filters in map view if the nav ball is hidden.
